ExtendedSection.Title: Transformation methods of the image bean (incomplete)

Text.name: Text0
Text.content: Scales the image to the provided width, wher {width} should be the target width in pixels, e.g., 400.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content: Scales the image to the provided ratio, changing the height of the image, not the width. A ratio should have format, e.g., {ratio} could be 4-3, or 2.35-1 or 1,4-3,1.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content: Returns the high dpi version of the current image, e.g., scales it with the provided scaling factor (width and height). The scaling factor is given as number followed by 'x', e.g., {fact} can be 2x or 2.5x.

Text.name: Text0
Text.content: Returns the CmsImageScaler that is used for scaling the image. Here any possible transformation can be added and will be applied to the image. Note that this method can't be chained, since the return value is not an image bean.
